member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Devices.Ingenico.Barclaycard.RegSvr32Handler
member.summary: Starts and Stops a thread. The thread's purpose is to simply press the "OK" button on the message box generated by RegSvr32, which is run by the IPP350 ECR driver installer. The thread will not stop itself; StopThread must be called once the main program has decided that RegSvr32 has been dealt with.

member.summary: Indicates whether the thread is _running, and is used to exit the thread's loop.

member.summary: Starts the thread for clicking the OK button on the RegSvr32 message box.

member.summary: Stops the thread for clicking the OK button on the RegSvr32 message box.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Devices.Ingenico.Barclaycard.RegSvr32Handler.ThreadWorker
member.summary: Contains the thread loop for clicking OK on the RegSvr32 message box. Do not call directly; instead, call StartThread().

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Devices.Ingenico.Barclaycard.RegSvr32Handler.SetForegroundWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Brings the thread that created the specified window into the foreground and activates the window. Keyboard input is directed to the window, and verious visual cues are changed for the user. The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that created the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.param: A handle to the window that should be activated and brought to the foreground.
member.returns: If the window was brought to the foreground, returns true. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Devices.Ingenico.Barclaycard.RegSvr32Handler.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Devices.Ingenico.Barclaycard.RegSvr32Handler.SwCmd)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's show state.
member.param: A handle to the window.

Controls how the window is to be shown. This parameter is ignored the first time an application calls ShowWindow, if the program that launched the application provides a STARTUPINFO structure. Otherwise, the first time ShowWindow is called, the value should be the value obtained by the WinMain function in its nCmdShow parameter. In subsequent calls, this parameter can be one of .
member.returns: If the window was previously visible, the return value is true. Otherwise, false.

member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.OTIDef.OpCode
member.summary: The types of commands the Host can communicate to the PCD (Saturn Device)

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.OTIDef.OpCode.SET
member.summary:
Configures one or more of the PCD power-up default parameters. Multiple tags may be used for this command.
Note: The SET command does NOT activate the new configuration. The Host must send a DO "Load Default Parameters" or DO "Reset PCD" command to activate the new settings.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.OTIDef.OpCode.GET
member.summary:
The Host uses the GET command to get data from the PCD. Multiple tags can be used within this command; the Host sends the request as a list of TLV objects.
Note: When requesting a parameter, the returned value is a default value (from PCD non-volatile memory) and not from the PCD active values (volatile memory. Hence the parameter might not represent the current status of the PCD (e.g. after performing a SET and before resetting the PCD or performing Load Default Parameters).

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.OTIDef.OpCode.DO
member.summary:
Instructs the PCD to perform (activate) one request.
The message is in TLV-like format, where the tag is an instruction and the values are relevant parameters. The PCD responds to the Host only after completing execution of the included tag.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.OTIDef.OpCode.NAK
member.summary: Only used in a NAK handshake with the device. The device will use this opcode if it has a problem with the command that was sent to it.

member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.S6500.Cmds.CMD_SET_EnableApplication

True indicates that Visa Virtual will be enabled when this CMD_SET_EnableApplication is sent to the device. False indicates that Visa Virtual will be disabled.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Devices.OnTrackInnovations.S6500.Saturn6500.TrackIIAscii(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary:
Translates TrackII data from a BCD format into Ascii. Assumption is that TrackII is in BCD format.
Also, OTI is inconsistent with whether they include the track data's start/stop delimiters. This method will insert the delimiters if necessary.
member.param: The card data collection, from which this method uses the value associated with key "TrackII".
member.returns: Returns the Ascii-formatted byte array of TrackII.

member.summary: OTI is inconsistent with whether they include the track data's start/stop characters. This method will insert the character if necessary.
member.param: The card data collection, from which this method uses the value associated with key "TrackI".
member.returns: TrackI with % and ? delimiters restored if they were missing.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Devices.Verifone.Commands.XPICommand.GetIntegerStringOfDecimal(System.Decimal)
member.summary:
Translate a decimal value to a an integer string representation. The decimal value is multiplied by 100 to remove the values after the decimal point and then converted to an integer.
NOTE: No rounding is applied to the decimal value. Example: 1.00 -> 100; 123.45 -> 12345
member.param: Decimal value to be translated.
member.returns: Integer representation of the decimal value.

member.summary: Static class with a singular function: to sanitize SnapLogic JSON strings of sensitive data for the purposes of being logged.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.Sanitize(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string with sensitive data sanitized.
member.param: The JSON request string to be sanitized.
member.returns: A sanitized copy of .

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.GetAllJsonMatchValues(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds all JSON '"" : "fieldValue"' instances in , and returns an array of the associated fieldValue.
member.param: The JSON document from which to parse for the .
Indicates which field(s) in particular are of interest.
member.returns: An array of values associated with the .

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeSubcardNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces subcardNumber instances' values with asterisks and the last 4 digits.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with subcardNumber values in the format of "*********1234".

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeGuestId(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces guestId instances' values with the first and last characters separated by asterisks.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with guestId values in the format of "A*****3".

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeMemberFirstName(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces memberFirstName instances' values with the initial followed by three asterisks.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with memberFirstName in the format of "T***" (always 3 asterisks).
member.remarks: The number of asterisks must stay constant as to not hint at the length of a person's name.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeMemberLastName(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces memberLastName instances' values with the initial followed by three asterisks.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with memberLastName in the format of "S***" (always 3 asterisks).
member.remarks: The number of asterisks must stay constant as to not hint at the length of a person's name.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeAccountId(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces accountID instances' values with asterisks and the last 4 digits.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with accountID values in the format of "*********1234".

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeOfferPropositionGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces propositionGUID instances' values with asterisks and the last 6 digits.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with propositionGUID values in the format of "********************************************7f23d3"

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeOfferClickToActionUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces offerClickToActionUrl instances' values with "[URL Removed]"
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with offerClickToActionUrl values replaced with "[URL Removed]"

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeCertificateSerialNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces serialNumber instances' values with asterisks and the last 4 digits.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with serialNumber values in the format of "***********8923".

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicJsonSanitization.SanitizeGuestPhoneNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces guestPhoneNumber and phoneNumber instances' values with asterisks and the last 4 digits.
member.param: The JSON string to sanitize.
member.returns: The string with guestPhoneNumber/phoneNumber values in the format of "******1932".

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.SnapLogicRequest.BuildCertificateListElement(SPMPinpad.LoyaltyGateway.SnapLogic.Enums.RequestTypes)
member.summary: Builds and returns a List of , populated with data from the 's in this.PrimaryAccount.Certificates and 's in this.PaymentDetail.TenderDetailCollection.
member.param: The type of SnapLogic request that the resulting list of is intended for.
member.returns: List of with properties populated. Returns null if there are no 's to process.
member.exception: Thrown when is GuestLookup, VoucherInquiry or LoyaltyPhoneLookup. These SnapLogic requests do not accept a list of 's.

Thrown when is Redeem AND this.PaymentDetail.TenderDetailCollection doesn't have a matching item in this.PrimaryAccount.Certificates or vice-versa.
There must be an entry in both lists so that the forfeited amount can be calculated for the Redeem call.

member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.summary: The function retrieves a device instance handle for the specified device if the device is currently configured in the device tree or the device is a nonpresent device that is not currently configured in the device tree.

member.summary: The function retrieves a device instance handle for the specified device if the device is currently configured in the device tree or in the process of being removed from the device tree. If the device is in the process of being removed, the function cancels the removal of the device.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.LocateDevNodeFlags.CM_LOCATE_DEVNODE_NOVALIDATION
member.summary: Not Used.

member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags
member.summary: Caller-supplied flags that specify how reenumeration should occur. Each of these flags can be used in combination with each other.
member.remarks: To be used for the ulFlags parameter in CM_Reenumerate_DevNode(...)

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags.CM_REENUMERATE_ASYNCHRONOUS
member.summary: Reenumeration should occur asynchronously. The call to this function returns immediately after the PnP manager receives the reenumeration request. If this flag is set, the CM_REENUMERATE_SYNCHRONOUS flag should not also be set.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags.CM_REENUMERATE_NORMAL
member.summary: Specifies default reenumeration behavior, in which reenumeration occurs synchronously. This flag is functionally equivalent to CM_REENUMERATE_SYNCHRONOUS.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags.CM_REENUMERATE_RETRY_INSTALLATION
member.summary:
Specifies that Plug and Play should make anothe rattempt to install any devices in the specified subtree that have been detected but are not yet configured, or are marked as needing reinstallation, or for which installation must be completed. This flag can be set along with either the CM_REENUMERATE_SYNCHRONOUS flag or the CM_REENUMERATE_ASYNCHRONOUS flag.
This flag must be used with extreme caution, because it can cause the PnP manager to prompt the user to perform installation of any such devices. Currently, only components such as Device Manager and Hardware Wizard can use this flag, to allow the user to retry installation of devices that might already have been detected but are not currently installed.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags.CM_REENUMERATE_SYNCHRONOUS
member.summary: Reenumeration should occur synchronously. The call to this function returns when all devices in the specified subtree have been reenumerated. If this flag is set, the CM_REENUMERATE_ASYNCHRONOUS flag should not also be set. This flag is functionally equivalent to CM_REENUMERATE_NORMAL.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.CM_Locate_DevNodeA(System.Int32@,System.String,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.LocateDevNodeFlags)
member.summary: The CM_Locate_DevNode function obtains a device instance handle to the device node that is associated with a specified device instance ID on the local machine.
member.param: A pointer to a device instance handle that CM_Locate_DevNode retrieves. The retrieved handle is bound to the local machine.

A pointer to a NULL-terminated string representing a device instance ID. If this value is NULL, or if it points to a zero-length string, the function retrieves a device instance handle to the device at the root of the device tree.
A variable of ULONG type that supplies one of the flag values that apply if the caller supplies a device instance identifier.
member.returns: If the operation succeeds, CM_Locate_DevNode returns CR_SUCCESS. Otherwise, the function returns one of the CR_Xxx error codes that are defined in Cfgmgr32.h
member.remarks: CM_Locate_DevNodeA is the ANSI variation of CM_Locate_DevNode.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.CM_Reenumerate_DevNode(System.Int32,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.ReenumerateFlags)
member.summary: The CM_Reenumerate_DevNode function enumerates the devices identified by a specified device node and all of its children.
member.param: Caller-supplied device instance handle that is bound to the local machine.
Caller-supplied flags that specify how reenumeration should occur.
member.returns: If the operation succeeds, the function returns CR_SUCCESS. Otherwise, it returns one of the CR_-prefixed error codes defined in Cfgmgr32.h

member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the SP_CLASSINSTALL_HEADER structure.

member.summary: The device installation request (DIF code) for the class install parameters structure.

member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS
member.summary: The state change action.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS.DICS_ENABLE
member.summary:
The device is being enabled.
For this state change, Windows enables the device if the DICS_FLAG_GLOBAL flag is specified.
If the DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC flag is specified and the current hardware profile is specified, then Windows enables the device. If the DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC is specified and not the current hardware propfile, then Windows sets some flags in the registry and does not change the device's state. Windows will change the device state when the specified profile becomes the current profile.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS.DICS_DISABLE
member.summary:
The device is being disabled.
For this state change, Windows disables the device if the DICS_FLAG_GLOBAL flag is specified.
If the DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC flag is specified and the current hardware profile is specified then Windows disables the device. If the DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC is specified and not the current hardware profile then Windows sets some flags in the registry and does not change the device's state.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS.DICS_PROPCHANGE
member.summary:
The properties of the device have changed.
For this state change, Windows ignores the Scope information as long it is a valid value, and stops and restarts the device.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS.DICS_START
member.summary:
The device is being started (if the request is for the currently active hardware profile).
DICS_START must be DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC. You cannot perform that change globally.
Windows only starts the device if the current hardware profile is specified. Otherwise, Windows sets a registry flag and does not change the state of the device.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS.DICS_STOP
member.summary:
The device is being stopped. The driver stack will be unloaded and the CSCONFIGFLAG_DO_NOT_START flag will be set for the device.
DISC_STOP must be DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC. You cannot perform that change globally.
Windows only stops the device if the current hardware profile is specified. Otherwise, Windows sets a registry flag and does not change the state of the device.

member.name: T:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS_FLAG
member.summary: Flags that specify the scope of a device property change.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS_FLAG.DICS_FLAG_GLOBAL
member.summary: Make the change is all hardware profiles.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS_FLAG.DICS_FLAG_CONFIGSPECIFIC
member.summary: Make the change in the specified profile only.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DICS_FLAG.DICS_FLAG_CONFIGGENERAL
member.summary: Obsolete. Do not use.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_PROPCHANGE_PARAMS.Scope

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiGetClassDevsW(System.Guid@,System.String,System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.DIGCF)
member.summary: The SetupDiGetClassDevs function returns a handle to a device information set that contains requested device information elements for a local computer.
member.param:
[in, optional]
A pointer to the GUID for a device setup class or a device interface class. This pointer is optional and can be NULL.

[in, optional]
A pointer to a NULL-terminated string that specifies:
- An identifier (ID) of a Plug and play (PnP) enumerator. This ID can either be the value's globally unique identifier (GUID) or a symbolic name. For example, "PCI" can be used to specify the PCI PnP value. Other examples of symbolic names for PnP values include "USB," "PCMCIA", and "SCSI".
- A PnP device instance ID. When specifying a PnP device instance ID, DIGCF_DEVICEINTERFACE must be set in the Flags parameter.
This pointer is optional and can be NULL. If an enumeration value is not used to select devices, set to NULL.

[in, optional]
A handle to the top-level window to be used for a user interface that is associated with installing a device instance in the device information set. This handle is optional and can be NULL.

[in]
A variable of type DWORD that specifies control options that filter the device information elements that are added to the device information set. This parameter can be a bitwise OR of zero or more of the SetupDiGetClassDevsFlags.
member.returns: If the operation succeeds, SetupDiGetClassDevs returns a handle to a device information set that contains all installed devices that matched the supplied parameters. If the operation fails, the function returns INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiDestroyDeviceInfoList(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SetupDiDestroyDeviceInfoList function deletes a device information set and frees all associated memory.
member.param: A handle to the device information set to delete.
member.returns: The function returns TRUE if it is successful. Otherwise, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved with a call to GetLastError.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiEnumDeviceInfo(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA@)
member.summary: The SetupDiEnumDeviceInfo function returns a SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that specifies a device information element in a device information set.
member.param: A handle to the device information set for which to return an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that represents a device information element.
A zero-based index of the device information element to retrieve.
A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure to receive information about an enumerated device information element. The caller must set DeviceInfoData.cbSize to sizeof(SP_DEVINFO_DATA).
member.returns: The function returns TRUE if it is successful. Otherwise, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved with a call to GetLastError.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiSetClassInstallParams(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA@,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_PROPCHANGE_PARAMS@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The SetupDiSetClassInstallParams function sets or clears class install parameters for a device information set or a particular device information element.
member.param: A handle to the device information set for which to set class install parameters.

Optional. A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that represents the device for which to set class install parameters. This parameter is optional and can be NULL. If this parameter is specified, SetupDiSetClassInstallParams sets the class installation parameters for the specified device. If the parameter is NULL, \ SetupDiSetClassInstallParams sets the class install parameters that are associated with DeviceInfoSet.

Optional. A pointer to a buffer that contains the new class install parameters to use. The SP_CLASSINSTALL_HEADER structure at the beginning of this buffer must have its cbSize field set to sizeof((SP_CLASSINSTALL_HEADER) and the InstallFunction field must be set to the DI_FUNCTION code that reflects the type of parameters contained in the rest of the buffer.
If ClassInstallParams is not specified, the current class install parameters, if any, are cleared for the specified device information set or element.
The size, in bytes, of the ClassInstallParams buffer. If the buffer is not supplied (that is, the class install parameters are being cleared), ClassInstallParamsSize must be 0.
member.returns: The function returns TRUE if it is successful. Otherwise, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved with a call to GetLastError.
member.remarks:
All parameters are validated before any changes are made. Therefore, a return value of FALSE indicates that no parameters were modified.
A side effect of setting class install parameters is that the DI_CLASSINSTALLPARAMS flag is set. If the caller wants to set the parameters, but disable their use, this flag must be cleared by a call to SetupDiSetDeviceInstallParams.
If the class install parameters are cleared, the DI_CLASSINSTALLPARAMS flag is reset.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiChangeState(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA@)
member.summary: The SetupDiChangeState function is the default handler for the DIF_PROPERTYCHANGE installation request.
member.param: A handle to a device information set for the local computer. This set contains a device information element that represents the device whose statis to be changed.

A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that specifies the device information element in DeviceInfoSet. This is an IN-OUT parameter because DeviceInfoData.DevInst might be updated with a new handle upon return.
member.returns: The function returns TRUE if it is successful. Otheriwse, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved by making a call to GetLastError.

member.summary: The function retrieves a REG_SZ string that contains the name that is associated with the device's PDO. For more information, see IoCreateDevice.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_REMOVAL_POLICY
member.summary: (Windows XP and later) The function retrieves the device's current removal policy as a DWORD that contains one of the CM_REMOVAL_POLICY_Xxx values that are defined in Cfgmgr32.h.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_REMOVAL_POLICY_HW_DEFAULT
member.summary: (Windows XP and later) The function retrieves the device's hardware-specified default removal policy as a DWORD that contains one of the CM_REMOVAL_POLICY_Xxx values that are defined in Cfgmgr32.h

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_REMOVAL_POLICY_OVERRIDE
member.summary: (Windows XP and later) The function retrieves the device's override removal policy (if it exists) from the registry, as a DWORD that contains one of the CM_REMOVAL_POLICY_Xxx values that are defined in Cfgmgr32.h

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_SECURITY
member.summary: The function retrieves a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure for a device.

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_SECURITY_SDS
member.summary: The function retrieves a REG_SZ string that contains the device's security descriptor. For information about security descriptor strings, see Security Descriptor Definition Language (Windows). For information about the format of security descriptor stringsm, see Security Descriptor Definition Language (WINDOWS).

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_SERVICE

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_UI_NUMBER

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_UI_NUMBER_DESC_FORMAT

member.name: F:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP.SPDRP_UPPERFILTERS

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiGetDeviceRegistryPropertyW(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA@,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The SetupDiGetDeviceRegistryProperty function retrieves a specified Plug and Play device property.
member.param: A handle to a device information set that contains a device information element that represents the device for which to retrieve a Plug and Play property.
A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that specifies the device information element in .
Specifies which property to retrieve.

Out, Optional. A pointer to a variable that receives the data type of the property that is being retrieved. This is one of the standard registry data types. This parameter is optional and can be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the property that is being retrieved. If this parameter is set to NULL, and is also set to zero, the function returns the required size for the buffer in .
The size, in bytes, of the buffer.

Out, Optional. A pointer to a variable of type DWORD that receives the required size, in bytes, of the buffer that is required to hold the data for the requested property. This parameter is optional and can be NULL.
member.returns: Setup DiGetDeviceRegistryProperty returns TRUE if the call was successful. Otherwise, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved by making a call to GetLastError. SetupDiGetDeviceRegistryProperty returns the ERROR_INVALID_DATA error code if the requested property does not exist for a device data is not valid.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetDeviceActivity(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/Disables a hardware device. Effectively the same as (in device manager) right-clicking a device and selecting Enable or Disable.
member.param: Filters the Enable/Disable command to be sent to the hardware device with ID containing the hardwareIdFilter string.
True to enable the device; false to disable the device.
member.returns: False if did not match any devices or otherwise could not enable/disable the device. Returns True if the device is found and enabled/disabled as required.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.CheckError(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the last Win32 Error. If there was an error, or if != 0 or -1, throws an ApplicationException.
member.param: The message to include with the ApplicationException.
At default value (-1), the method will get the last win32 error. If lasterror != -1, the lasterror value is treated as the error code in place of the win32 error code.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.GetStringPropertyForDevice(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SPDRP)

member.param: A handle to a device information set that contains a device information element that represents the device for which to retrieve a Plug and Play property.
A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that specifies the device information element in .
Specifies which device property to retrieve.
member.returns: The string representation of the specified device's specified property.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.GetDeviceStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the device status for the device that has a device ID like .
member.param: The pattern to which the deviceid must match. Uses the syntax rules of WQL/SQL: "... where deviceid like '[pattern]'".
member.returns: The status of the specified device. If matches no devices, returns an empty string.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.GetDevicePresence(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if a device with device ID containing is present/connected to the machine.
member.param: Filters to a device profile containing the hardwareIdFilter.
member.returns: True of the device is found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SetupDiRemoveDevice(System.IntPtr,SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.SP_DEVINFO_DATA@)
member.summary: The SetupDiRemoveDevice function is the default handler for the DIF_REMOVE installation request.
member.param:
[in]
A handle to a device information set for the local system that contains a device information element that represents the device to remove.

[in, out]
A pointer to an SP_DEVINFO_DATA structure that specifies the device information element in DeviceInfoSet. This is an IN-OUT parameter because DeviceInfoSet.DevInst might be updated with a new handle value upon return. If this is a global removal or the last hardware profile-specific removal, all traces of the device instance are deleted from the registry and the handle will be NULL.
member.returns: The function returns TRUE if it is successful. Otherwise, it returns FALSE and the logged error can be retrieved by a call to GetLastError.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.WindowsDeviceManager.RemoveDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Removes from the system the device with Hardware ID containing . Deletes the device's hardware and software registry keys and any hardware-profile-specific registry keys (configuration-specific registry keys).
member.param: Filters the device removal command to be sent only to the hardware device with ID containing the hardwareIdFilter string.
member.returns: False if hardwareIdFilter is null or whitespace, or if an error occurs while iterating through the hardware devices.

member.name: M:SPMPinpad.Utilities.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
